issue.title: [Website] FAQ page (and others) should allow linking to a heading
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13029](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13029). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
For convenience, we should expose a link to headings on pages like the FAQ and in blog posts, so you can easily link to a particular FAQ entry or a section of a release post in things like answering StackOverflow questions. (Headings already have an ID assigned, there's just no link exposed to easily grab.)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13029?focusedCommentId=17360392) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I feel like I looked into this once, and there were some no-longer-supported Jekyll plugins to do this, and some jquery hacks. I think this is around the time I explored porting the website to Hugo :D

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13029?focusedCommentId=17360396) by David Li (lidavidm):*
I was trying to recall how I did it for my own site, and it turns out I used https://github.com/allejo/jekyll-anchor-headings which is a bit…messy, but works.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13029?focusedCommentId=17360843) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Or you migrate the FAQ to Sphinx and get these kind of things for free... But we can also stay on an inferior format.
